AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck camper: Vehicle used in the transportation of undocumented aliens on Interstate Highway 35, containing a camper compartment with occupants, stopped more than 100 miles from the United States-Mexican border. Exhibited heavily loaded appearance with a camper attachment. Often used to transport illegal aliens, with windows that appeared fogged suggesting living cargo. Described as being overloaded. Occupants were observed reacting to a bright light from border patrol agents. Passengers in the back seat appeared to slouch down as the vehicle passed the agents.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.marked border patrol sedan: United States Border Patrol vehicle used by agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron for surveillance and arrest
